channel.title: Comments on: Joy Division reissue campaign to coincide with release of Control

item.title: By: Twyla
item.dc:creator: Twyla
item.description: It is a JOY to actual hear about this band which I never heard of before, thanks for the re releases...
item.content:encoded: It is a JOY to actual hear about this band which I never heard of before, thanks for the re releases…

item.title: By: Joy Division vinyl box set can be yours for...$200?, Drawer B
item.dc:creator: Joy Division vinyl box set can be yours for...$200?, Drawer B
item.description: [...] doing his signature dance? What exactly does one find inside this artfully drab packaging? The ethics of reissuing and repackaging the same old shit aside, how did Rhino come up with a $200 price tag [...]
item.content:encoded: […] doing his signature dance? What exactly does one find inside this artfully drab packaging? The ethics of reissuing and repackaging the same old shit aside, how did Rhino come up with a $200 price tag […]

item.title: By: Logan Young
item.dc:creator: Logan Young
item.description: the only reason to release something that's already there - and brilliant at that - is for the extras. if we find warsaw's cover of "that's alright (mama)" then we should probably release that. otherwise, it amounts to exactly what kerry said 8 comments ago - "sad and embarrassing." hopefully, "control" will spur some confused, depressed, pock-mocked 15-year-old to go out and buy "unknown pleasures"...just as an ex-girlfriend's break-up mix tape inspired me to do the same. if i believed in god, i would just pray that "Yogan Loung" doesn't find it in a new, deluxe, director's cut, commentary by joe levy, re-issue at target.
item.content:encoded: the only reason to release something that’s already there – and brilliant at that – is for the extras. if we find warsaw’s cover of “that’s alright (mama)” then we should probably release that. otherwise, it amounts to exactly what kerry said 8 comments ago – “sad and embarrassing.” hopefully, “control” will spur some confused, depressed, pock-mocked 15-year-old to go out and buy “unknown pleasures”…just as an ex-girlfriend’s break-up mix tape inspired me to do the same. if i believed in god, i would just pray that “Yogan Loung” doesn’t find it in a new, deluxe, director’s cut, commentary by joe levy, re-issue at target.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
I don't know exactly what I'm arguing. I think I just find the flogging sad. I love JD, I just think re-re-re-re-releasing their records and more live discs, etc. dilutes things and comes across as a desperate attempt to continue to cash in on Ian.
Anyone unfamiliar with Joy Division who sees Control and wants to hear more JD should have no trouble tracking down a copy of Closer, Still, Permanent, Unknown Pleasures, Heart&Soul, Preston, et al., without requiring re-releases and more live records.
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know exactly what I’m arguing. I think I just find the flogging sad. I love JD, I just think re-re-re-re-releasing their records and more live discs, etc. dilutes things and comes across as a desperate attempt to continue to cash in on Ian.

Anyone unfamiliar with Joy Division who sees Control and wants to hear more JD should have no trouble tracking down a copy of Closer, Still, Permanent, Unknown Pleasures, Heart&Soul, Preston, et al., without requiring re-releases and more live records.

item.title: By: Sean Dodson
item.dc:creator: Sean Dodson
item.description: sure, they're flogging it. But are u arguing that nobody should ever release another Joy Division record ever again? And if so, how would u package it?
item.content:encoded: sure, they’re flogging it. But are u arguing that nobody should ever release another Joy Division record ever again? And if so, how would u package it?

item.title: By: Logan Young
item.dc:creator: Logan Young
item.description: i'm off two minds about this one. yes, they've been beating a dead, epileptic horse for quite some time now. even martin hannet's in on it: http://www.normanrecords.com/records/89708 i think it's the re-to-the-fourth-power releasing of all of the catalog - both studio proper and otherwise - that's the ethical dilemma. and yet, if more people are turned on to them that's fucking great.
item.content:encoded:
i’m off two minds about this one. yes, they’ve been beating a dead, epileptic horse for quite some time now. even martin hannet’s in on it:
http://www.normanrecords.com/records/89708
i think it’s the re-to-the-fourth-power releasing of all of the catalog – both studio proper and otherwise – that’s the ethical dilemma. and yet, if more people are turned on to them that’s fucking great.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Sean, they've been flogging Ian's dead body for nigh 3 decades now. The records have been re-re-released. Did you watch the <a href="http://www.drawerb.com/2007/09/13/wired-joy-division-1988/" rel="nofollow">Documentary</a>?
item.content:encoded: Sean, they’ve been flogging Ian’s dead body for nigh 3 decades now. The records have been re-re-released. Did you watch the Documentary?
